episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the environmental impact of hippo waste on river ecosystems, the extreme non-violence practices of Jain monks, the inventive ways American pilots made ice cream during World War II, and a humorous referendum in Saskatchewan about toilet paper orientation.

facts.fact: Hippos sometimes poo into rivers so much that all the fish downstream die.
There are monks in India who avoid going out in the rain in case they splash through puddles and upset the microbes in them.
During the Second World War, while American pilots were flying over enemy territory, not only were they shooting at the enemy, but they were also often making ice cream at the same time.
In 1997, a town in Saskatchewan held a referendum on whether the end of a toilet paper should hang under or over the roll.
